titles.title: Parental Bereavement Act of 2015
Sarah Grace-Farley-Kluger Act
A bill to amend the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 to provide leave because of the death of a son or daughter.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary:
5/12/2015--Introduced. Parental Bereavement Act of 2015 or the Sarah Grace-Farley-Kluger Act
Amends the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 to entitle an eligible employee to up to 12 workweeks of leave during any 12-month period because of the death of a son or daughter.
Allows such an employee to substitute any available paid leave for any leave without pay.
Applies the same leave entitlement to federal employees.
